about.title: About me
about.text: Web developer, with one year of experience working with Javascript, React, NodeJS, Graphql, Sequelize and other libraries in frontend and some backend projects. I am a person who is passionate about constant learning, self-taught and focused on improving myself every day. I like jobs that challenge me with the use of new technologies. Among my professional goals are to find a workplace that allows me to grow and in which I can get involved in a good work environment.

turneroBack.name: Patient-Appointment Back-End
turneroBack.description: This API for a dental-center system was built with a MySQL database and packaged with webpack. Sequelize was used to create the data models and GraphQL provided fast query handling, using Apollo as the server

turneroFront.name: Patient-Appointment Front-end
turneroFront.description: The Front end of the shift system was created from the colors used by the dental center, designed in CSS, achieving an easy to use and responsive page. I used the React framework, taking advantage of the react-router package, and Apollo Client as a connection to the database

register.name: Registration in steps
register.description: This step-by-step form that works as a registration for a freelance user page, uses React as a framework, CSS to style the app skeleton, and some MUI Material components.

card.name: Challenge Card
card.description: This is my second Frontend Mentor challenge, I chose a basic card that took me approximately 2 hours. I used react as framework, styling the components with css. On this occasion I took the opportunity to use the Vite compiler, it was a fast and agile experience for me.

landingPage.name: Landing page Freelance
landingPage.description: This sample landing page was created for a client working as a freelance. It is completely customized by css, using libraries like fontAwesome, using React as a framework.

portfolio.name: Portfolio
portfolio.description: The portfolio in which we are located, was created and written in Javascript, using React, and some libraries such as Font Awesome, emailjs, bootstrap and react-router.

input-tag.description: I did this project to improve and automate an existing Material UI component. It is a container box in which you can write to add some nice tags by keyboard, or delete them also by keyboard or through one click.

challenge-FE-Mentor.name: CC Challenge
challenge-FE-Mentor.description: FrontEnd Mentor Challenge in which I was able to deepen my knowledge in forms and validations of entered data. It is developed with React, Vite and CSS.
